title: American Football to Share New Live in Los Angeles Concert Film
description: The film, which documents the 25th-anniversary tour for the band’s debut album, captures a performance at El Rey Theatre
author: Walden Green
excerpt: The film, which documents the 25th-anniversary tour for the band’s debut album, captures a performance at El Rey Theatre
text: Last year, American Football celebrated the 25th anniversary of their landmark debut album with a series of live performances. Now, that tour will be immortalized in the form of a concert film. American Football (Live in Los Angeles) was recorded across two nights at Los Angeles’ El Rey Theatre. Directed by Steph Rinzler and featuring interviews with Ethel Cain, Yvette Young, and M.A.G.S., the film is set to premiere tonight (July 2) at 9:00 p.m. Eastern Daylight Time on the band’s YouTube channel.American Football (Live in Los Angeles) is accompanied by the official release of American Football’s first live album. The record, which includes renditions of all the songs on the emo lodestars’ debut, was originally made available on Bandcamp earlier this year, with proceeds going to benefit victims of the California wildfires. Vinyl pressings will come with an eight-page booklet of photographs from the El Rey Theatre shows taken by Atiba Jefferson. Listen to the album below.Alongside remastering and reissuing their debut LP in 2024, American Football shared a full-album covers compilation with contributions from Iron & Wine, Manchester Orchestra, and Blondshell, among others. The house that appears on the cover of American Football—which the band co-owns alongside Polyvinyl Records—has also been available to rent on Airbnb since last year. American Football shared their third and, to date, latest studio album, also titled American Football, in 2019.Read about the first American Football at No. 38 in “The 150 Best Albums of the 1990s.”
html:
Last year, American Football celebrated the 25th anniversary of their landmark debut album with a series of live performances. Now, that tour will be immortalized in the form of a concert film. American Football (Live in Los Angeles) was recorded across two nights at Los Angeles’ El Rey Theatre. Directed by Steph Rinzler and featuring interviews with Ethel Cain, Yvette Young, and M.A.G.S., the film is set to premiere tonight (July 2) at 9:00 p.m. Eastern Daylight Time on the band’s YouTube channel.

American Football (Live in Los Angeles) is accompanied by the official release of American Football’s first live album. The record, which includes renditions of all the songs on the emo lodestars’ debut, was originally made available on Bandcamp earlier this year, with proceeds going to benefit victims of the California wildfires. Vinyl pressings will come with an eight-page booklet of photographs from the El Rey Theatre shows taken by Atiba Jefferson. Listen to the album below.

Alongside remastering and reissuing their debut LP in 2024, American Football shared a full-album covers compilation with contributions from Iron & Wine, Manchester Orchestra, and Blondshell, among others. The house that appears on the cover of American Football—which the band co-owns alongside Polyvinyl Records—has also been available to rent on Airbnb since last year. American Football shared their third and, to date, latest studio album, also titled American Football, in 2019.

Read about the first American Football at No. 38 in “The 150 Best Albums of the 1990s.”
